text: Robert Charles Krueger (September 19, 1935 â€“ April 30, 2022) was an American politician. He was born in New Braunfels, Texas. He was the U.S. Senator from Texas between January 1993 to June 1993, having replaced the retiring Senator Lloyd Bentsen. He lost the special election to Kay Bailey Hutchison. Krueger was the U.S. Representative from Texas's 21st congressional district from 1975 until 1979. Krueger was an Ambassador to Burundi from 1994 until 1995 and to Botswana from 1996 until 1996. He was a member of the Democratic Party.
